page.title: 07SKREENS PARK,ROXWELL
page.content: William Bramston owned Skreens. In 1834 he gave Â£500 for Roxwell School to be built. In 1906 Skreens was up for sale. A big game hunter called William Otho Nicholas Shaw occupied the house but in 1915 the house was for sale again and between 1915 and 1921 it was demolished. The farms were split up and sold off. Skreens Park is now owned by the scout movement. Scouts and Guides come from near and far to camp. There are a number of facilities at the campsite. They can sleep in dormitories or tents. There is a souvenir shop a telephone and post box. There are toilet and washing facilities milk and eggs delivered. Skreens is now owned by the{ESSEX {COUNTY COUNCIL.}
